Container.Name: Urbit
Container.Overview: Urbit is a clean-slate OS and network for the 21st century. Self-host your computer, identity and access to the urbit world.
Container.Description: Urbit is a personal server for self-sovereign personal and networked computing. Nock, a functional combinator, is built into Hoon, a system programming language, used to implement Arvo, a deterministic operating system, that communicates over Ames, a decentralized, encrypted P2P network. You can boot with docker your planet and access to the urbit network and apps.[br][br] [b][span style='color: #E80000;']Guide:[/span][/b][br] [b]/config[/b] : Boot your comet for a first free try or boot a planet with the key from the bridge. For getting the code to the landscape enter in the unraid terminal "docker container exec Urbit /bin/get-urbit-code"

Config.Name: Web Interface Port
Config.Description: Port 80 is used for Urbit's HTTP interface for both Landscape and for API calls to the ship.

Config.Name: UDP Ames Port
Config.Description: Port 34343 is set by default to be used by Ames for ship-to-ship communication.

Config.Name: Urbit Config Path
Config.Description: This is where Urbit will access the key or the data pier of an existing planet. A key file sampel-palnet.key will boot the sampel-palnet planet. For booting a comet create a file in .comet.
